snippet: Typically a student would need to join a program at an accredited school to receive student aid, but an initiative would permit federal money to flow to students who enroll in experimental programs.
abstract: Education Dept will unveil test program that will allow students to use federal education loans and grants for alternative educational opportunities like massive open online courses, or MOOCs, as part of effort to provide alternative to substandard for-profit colleges; Education Dept must approve experimental programs.

keywords.value: Institute for College Access and Success
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Typically a student would need to join a program at an accredited school to receive student aid, but an initiative would permit federal money to flow to students who enroll in experimental programs.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Approve Some Programs Eligible for Student Funding on Its Own
headline.main: New Federal Program Offers Students Aid for Nontraditional Education
